result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC shall withhold 25% of all inmate monies to pay fines/ costs/surcharges/restitution.  The balance due shall be a condition of extended supervision/parole.  If discharged with financial obligations owing, a civil judgment shall be entered and/or other collection procedures will be implemented.

Absolute sobriety.
No alcohol possession or consumption.
No contact with the victim or her parents or her family.
No dating relationships with women, unless pre-approved by the Agent.
Pay court costs, surcharges, and supervision fees.
